diagnosis-and-procedure-coding-event-pcs.title: Diagnosis and procedure coding with ICD-10-CM/PCS

cases.case_description:
A patient was hospitalized due to potential colon carcinoma. 
An exploratory laparotomy was conducted, revealing a prominent mass in the sigmoid colon. This section of the colon was then removed, and an end-to-end anastomosis was completed. During the operation, tiny nodules were observed on the liver, prompting a needle biopsy. The subsequent pathology report verified the diagnosis as adenocarcinoma of the sigmoid colon with liver metastasis.

A patient who had undergone prostate surgery was released with a urethral catheter still inserted. He was later readmitted because of urinary sepsis caused by methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA), linked to the catheter. The doctor validated the sepsis diagnosis resulting from MRSA. The catheter was taken out, and the patient was initiated on antibiotics. After showing considerable improvement over a few days, the patient was sent home without a catheter.

diagnosis-and-procedure-coding-event-cpt.title: Diagnosis and procedeure coding with ICD-10-CM and CPT

cases.case_description:
PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: 
Prior history of polyps in the colon.
Persistent constipation.

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS:

Presence of a single colon polyp.
Minor diverticulosis in the sigmoid colon.
PERFORMED PROCEDURE:
Colonoscopy accompanied by a biopsy.

ANESTHESIA:
Supervision under anesthesia care.

BLOOD LOSS ESTIMATION:
Insignificant.

COMPLICATIONS:
None observed.

COLLECTED SPECIMEN:
Polyp located at the 20 cm mark.

REASON FOR PROCEDURE:
A 68-year-old male, previously diagnosed with polyps and recent increased constipation, sought further assessment.

PROCEDURE DETAILS:
After informed consent was secured and the procedure's risks, benefits, and other options were discussed, the patient was prepped in the endoscopy room and positioned on his left side. Anesthesia care was administered. Once sedation reached desired levels, a manual rectal examination was done, revealing no detectable masses or external rectal issues. A lubricated endoscope was smoothly inserted and directed up to the cecum, confirmed by spotting the ileocecal valve and the opening to the appendix. A thorough check of the ascending, transverse, and descending parts of the colon was conducted in a reverse and encompassing manner. A singular small polyp was identified in the sigmoid colon and was safely excised using a cold biopsy technique. Additionally, slight diverticulosis was observed in the sigmoid region. No other irregularities were seen. A backward view within the rectal chamber disclosed no inner anomalies of the anal passage. Following the examination, the endoscope was carefully removed and the patient was moved to recovery.

drug-medication-coding-event-atc.title: Drug and medication coding with ATC

cases.case_description:
Reason for Admission:

Acute exacerbation of congestive heart failure.
Diagnoses:

Congestive heart failure.
Type 2 diabetes mellitus.
Hypertension.
Medications on Discharge:

Furosemide 40 mg daily.
Metformin 500 mg twice daily.
Lisinopril 10 mg daily.
Recommendations:

Follow up with primary care physician in one week.
Monitor blood glucose levels daily and report any significant changes.
Restrict sodium intake and maintain a low-salt diet.
Begin cardiac rehabilitation as recommended.
